iconUsage.rule: NEVER use emojis - ALWAYS use leadingIcon or trailingIcon props
iconUsage.backNavigation: Use leadingIcon='chevron-back' for back navigation - never create custom SVG icons
iconUsage.actions: Use directional icons like 'arrow-forward' for continuation
iconUsage.consistency: Use the same icon for the same type of link throughout your application

childElementStyling.rule: NEVER add custom styling to anchor elements inside GoabLink
childElementStyling.explanation: GoabLink automatically styles all child anchor elements

spacing.inline: Use mr/ml for horizontal spacing in text content
spacing.lists: Use mb for consistent spacing in link lists
spacing.sections: Use mt for spacing links from other content
spacing.backNavigation: Use mb='l' for back navigation links to provide appropriate spacing
spacing.consistency: Apply the same spacing patterns for similar link groups

accessibility.descriptive: Ensure link text describes the destination or action
accessibility.context: Provide additional context for external links and downloads
accessibility.target: Use target='_blank' with proper rel attributes for external links
accessibility.labels: Use aria-label for additional context when needed

commonMistakes.mistake: Using invalid icon names that break component functionality
commonMistakes.why: Component only supports specific documented icon values - invalid names cause rendering failures
commonMistakes.instead: Always use valid icon names from the documented list and correction mappings
commonMistakes.example: // ❌ Wrong Change External // ✅ Correct Change External

commonMistakes.mistake: Using emojis instead of proper icon props
commonMistakes.why: Emojis break accessibility, are inconsistent across platforms, and don't follow design system patterns
commonMistakes.instead: Always use leadingIcon or trailingIcon props with proper icon names
commonMistakes.example: // ❌ Wrong ✏️ Change // ✅ Correct Change

commonMistakes.mistake: Adding custom styling to anchor elements inside GoabLink
commonMistakes.why: GoabLink automatically handles all styling for child anchor elements
commonMistakes.instead: Let GoabLink handle anchor styling automatically
commonMistakes.example: // ❌ Wrong Link // ✅ Correct Link

commonMistakes.mistake: Creating custom SVG icons for back navigation instead of using leadingIcon
commonMistakes.why: Custom icons break design system consistency and accessibility patterns
commonMistakes.instead: Always use leadingIcon='chevron-back' with proper spacing for back navigation
commonMistakes.example: // ❌ Wrong Back // ✅ Correct Back

commonMistakes.mistake: Adding custom CSS classes for styling instead of using design system props
commonMistakes.why: Custom styling breaks design system consistency and overrides component's built-in sizing
commonMistakes.instead: Use component props for spacing and let the component handle sizing automatically
commonMistakes.example: // ❌ Wrong Link // ✅ Correct Link

commonMistakes.mistake: Using Link component without wrapping an anchor element
commonMistakes.why: Link is an enhancement wrapper, not a replacement for anchor tags
commonMistakes.instead: Always wrap semantic <a> elements to preserve accessibility and navigation behavior

commonMistakes.mistake: Using Link for primary actions instead of buttons
commonMistakes.why: Links are for navigation, buttons are for actions - this confuses users and screen readers
commonMistakes.instead: Use GoabButton for actions, GoabLink only for navigation to other pages or resources

commonMistakes.why: Users expect visual indication when links open in new tabs or lead to external sites
commonMistakes.instead: Always add trailingIcon='open' for external links and ensure target='_blank'
commonMistakes.example: // ❌ Wrong External Site // ✅ Correct External Site

commonMistakes.mistake: Using custom CSS margins instead of design system spacing props
commonMistakes.why: Inconsistent spacing that doesn't align with design system spacing scale
commonMistakes.instead: Use mt, mr, mb, ml props with design system spacing tokens
commonMistakes.example: // ❌ Wrong Page Link // ✅ Correct Page Link

commonMistakes.mistake: Using vague link text that doesn't describe the destination
commonMistakes.why: Screen reader users often navigate by links and need descriptive text
commonMistakes.instead: Use specific, descriptive link text that makes sense out of context

frameworkNotes.propCasing: React uses camelCase (leadingIcon, trailingIcon) while web components use lowercase (leadingicon, trailingicon). Angular follows web component casing.
frameworkNotes.slotHandling: Default slot expects semantic anchor elements. The Link component enhances rather than replaces anchor tags.
frameworkNotes.constraints: Must contain anchor elements for proper semantics. Cannot be used as a standalone clickable element.
frameworkNotes.responsiveBehavior: Link styling adapts automatically through CSS, but wrapped anchor elements should include appropriate responsive attributes.
frameworkNotes.sizing: Component handles all sizing automatically - never add custom CSS classes for styling

iconValidation.problem: Invalid icon names causing component to break or not render icons
solutions: Use only documented valid icon names from the strictPropertyEnforcement section
Check the correctionMap for common mistakes (edit → pencil, back → chevron-back)
Verify icon name spelling matches exactly (case-sensitive)
Never use custom icon names not in the valid values list
Use design system spacing tokens (xs, s, m, l, etc.) not CSS units
Check that design tokens are loaded in your application
Verify parent container doesn't override margin styles
Use browser dev tools to inspect applied margin values
Ensure you're wrapping a proper <a> element, not other elements
Include proper href attribute on the anchor element
Add target='_blank' and rel='noopener' for external links
Use descriptive link text that makes sense out of context

stylingConflicts.problem: Link appearance doesn't match expected design
solutions: Link inherits default link styling - component only adds icons and spacing
Apply custom link styles to the anchor element, not the wrapper
Check for CSS specificity conflicts overriding link styles
Verify design tokens are loaded and accessible
Never add custom CSS classes - use component props instead

frameworkIssues.problem: Component doesn't work as expected in React/Angular
solutions: Use camelCase prop names in React (leadingIcon, trailingIcon)
Use kebab-case in Angular templates (leadingIcon, trailingIcon)
Ensure proper import statements for your framework
Check that the component module is properly imported in Angular
